review: There is a spiritual charm about this place. Lots of history, mythology, devotion and architecture around. Do not forget to visit the Archaeology museum.

title: Trekking opportunity
review: Although the recommendation was to travel to Jageshwar, we decided to visit the older Vriddha Jageshwar temple and then trek to the Jageshwar temple complex, after sending our car to wait at the KMVN.(Tourist rest house) We weren't disappointed by this choice. The trek was beautiful and peaceful and the distance took less than an hour to cover. Here are somethings to remember while doing this trek:

title: Ancient Temples
review: The buildings are ancient and there are few trees about 1200 years old as per the local people. Nothing out of the ordinary but since there isn't much except the weather and views of the Valley in Binsar we visited here and it was god.

title: Visit Jageshwar Dham while you are in Almora
review: Jageshwar dham is mainly famous for Shiva Temples. But it can be beautiful place to spend a couple days in tha lap of Himalayas. You spend time near the river bank which runs through the place. Trek around nearby villages. Trek to Old Jageshwar where the temple situated inside deep forest give panoramic view of Himalayan peaks. The temple is open form early morning. we went for Arati at the evening. it was worth seeing experience.

title: Jageshwar Dham Temple... More Than 200 Years Old Shiv Temple
review: Jageshwar Temple at a distance of 33 KM from Main Almora is situated in a very very peaceful environment covered with huge Pine trees.... This is a  200 years old temple... apart from the idols of Lord Shiva... it has an ancient idol of Lord Ganesh in which the trunk of Ganesh is on the right side.... this is the oldest statue of Ganesh.... even older than the one at Sidhi Vinayak Temple of Bombay.. This temple is also the home of 81st Shakti Peeth  of 108 Shakti Peeth of Mata.... The priest told us that the idole of Mata changes the face expressions three times in a day... and that it is practically proven & not any saying.... this is one of the finest temples of Almora & anyone visiting Almora, must visit this sacred place....

title: ancient place
review: 124 temples at one area. this is ancient historic temple. thanks to archeological department, govt. of India.

title: Historic temple complex
review: Clean and picturesque. An ancient tree in the courtyard, said to be many thousands of years old, made for a good photo.

title: Best place for Students of Archaeology
review: This is one of the oldest temple in this Country built almost in the 12th Century. The temple has beautiful idols of all Gods and Godesses. The temple has a beautiful landscape and a river flowing besides it. The place has its own charm and you will feel presence of god at this temple. The temple has one of the finest sculptures and has great history behind its creation. This is one of the ideal places to visit in Uttarakhand.

title: what to say!
review: Its a dham so obviously its going to be really well managed. car goes right till enterance and parking is close by.

title: A peaceful temple of Lord Shiva to visit
review: Jageshwar Dham is an ancient temple of Lord Shiva... Its an excellent temple to visit.... this temple is exactly in the lap of the mountains... wherever you see, there are mountains and mountains only.. this temple is under the ASI as it is very old built up.. it is an all stone built up temple.... one must visit this temple at least once... By the grace of Shiv Ji we have visited here three times....

title: A group of ancient temple
review: Its a group of temple. calm and quiet environment. no more bargain or touts near temple complex. one can spend only 2-3 hrs in the temple which is enough for doing some pujas

title: Abode of Lord Shiva.
review: Jageshwar Dham is located about 36 km from Almora. It is a holy place for the Hindus, and is believed to be one of the sites of the 12 Jyotirlingas.

title: Jageshwar Dham-- A Lord Shiva Temple
review: Jageshwar Temple is complex of a main temple (resident deity) with many small temples of deities of lesser hierarchy. This temple dedicated to Lord Shiva with his Svayambhu or naturally carved idol. Since it is also a Jyotirlinga, its importance becomes multiplies ten times.. Jageshwar Temple is situated in the lap of a valley & is surrounded by the huge mountains & pine trees... A must visit place for the travellers of Almora as the beauty of this temple & location is worth seeing... It is situated around 32 KM from Almora...
